No one rejects, dislikes, or avoids pleasure itself, because it is pleasure, but because those who do not know how to pursue pleasure rationally encounter consequences that are extremely painful. Nor again is there anyone who loves or pursues or desires to obtain pain of itself, because it is pain, but because occasionally circumstances occur in which toil and pain can procure him some great pleasure. To take a trivial example, which of us ever undertakes laborious physical exercise, except to obtain some advantage from it? But who has any right to find fault with a man who chooses to enjoy a pleasure that has no annoying consequences, or one who avoids a pain that produces no resultant pleasure?

A trivial limitation of Robotium is that, it can run test cases only on one given Application/Package. This blog gives a work around to overcome this Limitation. Problem Statement When you are testing system Apps in android you would have come across a situation where you need to test 2 applications which depend on each other. If you are doing it manually then its not a big deal but when it comes to automating it, it\'s one of the biggest challenge if you are using Robotium for testing these applications. Robotium is built on J-unit Frame Work and it runs test case on only one package which is specified in project\'s manifest file. Due to this running test case on multiple package is not possible.
Idea! In every automation testing basically we comparing Expected vs Actual. Most of the time both expected and actual values exist in same package but sometime it might happen that expected and actual may exist in different packages. So basically the Idea is to test these 2 test cases separately and whenever the expected and actual values has to exchanged, it can be kept at some place where it can be accessed by both the test cases. so there are 2 Possibilities: A trivial limitation of Robotium is that, it can run test cases only on one given Application/Package.
